URLPattern.summary: The URLPattern interface of the {{domxref("URL Pattern API", "", "", "nocode")}} matches URLs or parts of URLs against a pattern. The pattern can contain capturing groups that extract parts of the matched URL.

remarks.para:
More information about the syntax of patterns can be found on the API overview
page: {{domxref("URL Pattern API", "", "", "nocode")}}.

-A polyfill of URLPattern is available
on GitHub
-The pattern syntax used by URLPattern is similar to the syntax used by
path-to-regexp

URLPatternSearch.summary: The search read-only property of the interface is a string containing the pattern used to match the search part of a URL.

remarks.para: This is the normalized value of the search pattern passed to the constructor, an inherited value from a baseURL passed to the constructor, or the default value ("*"), which matches any search part.

URLPatternPathname.summary: The pathname read-only property of the interface is a string containing the pattern used to match the pathname part of a URL.

remarks.para: This is the normalized value of the pathname pattern passed to the constructor, an inherited value from a baseURL passed to the constructor, or the default value ("*"), which matches any path.

URLPatternProtocol.summary: The protocol read-only property of the interface is a string containing the pattern used to match the protocol part of a URL.

remarks.para: This is the normalized value of the protocol pattern passed to the constructor, an inherited value from a baseURL passed to the constructor, or the default value ("*"), which matches any protocol.

URLPatternHasRegExpGroups.summary: The hasRegExpGroups read-only property of the interface is a boolean indicating whether or not any of the URLPattern components contain regular expression capturing groups.

remarks.para: You can use the hasRegExpGroups property to check if a URLPattern object is usable with certain web platform APIs which do not allow regular expression capturing groups. For example:

URLPatternUsername.summary: The username read-only property of the interface is a string containing the pattern used to match the username part of a URL.

remarks.para: This is the normalized value of the username pattern passed to the constructor, or the default value ("*"), which matches any username.

URLPatternExec.summary: The exec() method of the interface takes a URL or object of URL parts, and returns either an object containing the results of matching the URL to the pattern, or null if the URL does not match the pattern.

remarks.para: -A polyfill of URLPattern is available on GitHub

URLPatternExec.returns: An that defines the matching elements and groups, or null if the passed inputs do not match the pattern.The object has the following properties:

URLPatternTest.summary: The test() method of the interface takes a URL string or object of URL parts, and returns a boolean indicating if the given input matches the current pattern.

remarks.para:
-A polyfill of URLPattern is available
on GitHub

URLPatternPort.summary: The port read-only property of the interface is a string containing the pattern used to match the port part of a URL.

remarks.para: This is the normalized value of the port pattern passed to the constructor, or an inherited value from a baseURL passed to the constructor, or the default value ("*"), which matches any port.

Note that it may also be set implicitly to the empty string ("") if the pattern is specified using an url or baseURL string and the port is not explicitly set.
This empty string matches against URLs that use the default port (443).

URLPatternPassword.summary: The password read-only property of the interface is a string containing the pattern used to match the password part of a URL.

remarks.para: This is the normalized value of the password pattern passed to the constructor or the default value ("*"), which matches any password.

URLPatternHash.summary: The hash read-only property of the interface is a string containing the pattern used to match the fragment part of a URL.

remarks.para: This is the normalized value of the hash pattern passed to the constructor, an inherited value from a baseURL passed to the constructor, or the default value ("*"), which matches any hash.

URLPatternHostname.summary: The hostname read-only property of the interface is a string containing the pattern used to match the hostname part of a URL.

remarks.para: This is the normalized value of the hostname pattern passed to the constructor, an inherited value from a baseURL passed to the constructor, or the default value ("*"), which matches any hostname.

URLPatternURLPattern.summary: The URLPattern() constructor returns a new object representing the URLs that will be matched by this pattern.

remarks.para:
-A polyfill of URLPattern is available
on GitHub
